pushto.stellarium¶

Interface to Stellarium Telescope Control plugin.

Provides:

  • stc_encode

  • stc_decode

  • StellariumTC

  • StellariumRPC

pushto.stellarium.stc_decode(data)¶

Decode a message from the Stellarium Telescope Control. This will always be a ‘Slew’ command.

Parameters:

data (bytearray) – data read from Stellarium socket

Returns:

(utc, ra, dec)

Return type:

list(str, float, float)

The message is 20B composed of:

  • size (2B): should be 20

  • type (2B): should be 0

  • time (8B): microseconds since epoch

  • ra_int (4B): value in range 0 to 4294967295

  • dec_int (4B): value in range -1073741824 to +1073741824

pushto.stellarium.stc_encode(utc, ra, dec)¶

Encode a messsage for the Stellarium Telescope Control. This is always a ‘CurrentPosition’ message.

Parameters:

  • utc (iso-formated string) – time

  • ra (float) – right ascension, in hours

  • dec (float) – declination, in degrees

Returns:

encoded data

Return type:

bytearray

The message is 24B composed of:

  • size (2B): should be 24

  • type (2B): should be 0

  • time (8B): microseconds since epoch

  • ra_int (4B): value in range 0 to 4294967295

  • dec_int (4B): value in range -1073741824 to +1073741824

  • status (4B): status, 0 means ok

>>> data = stc_encode(utc='2022-11-17T16:14:58.967345+00:00', ra=16.0, dec=70.0)
class pushto.stellarium.StellariumTC(stel_host, stel_port, data_sub_address, calib_pub_address, ctx=None)¶

Bases: Thread

Handles communications with the Stellarium Telescope Control (STC) over a tcp socket.

Parameters:

  • stel_host (str) – host on which Stellarium is running

  • stel_port (int) – port on which STC will connect

  • data_sub_address (str in form ‘tcp://127.0.0.1:10001’) – address to subscribe to the data stream

  • calib_pub_address (str in form ‘tcp://127.0.0.1:10001’) – address to publish calibration data

  • ctx (zmq.Context or None) – the zmq context, optional

>>> stel = StellariumTC('localhost', 10002, 'tcp://127.0.0.1:10012', 'tcp://127.0.0.1:10013')
>>> stel.handshake()
>>> stel.start()
>>> stel.close()

Note

RAW: connection to Stellarium

  • can send MoveTo commands with RA/Dec

  • can receive SlewTo commands with RA/Dec (requires pushing the button within Stellarium)

SUB: connection to control

  • receives telescope direction in RA/Dec

PUB: connection to control

  • sends SlewTo RA/Dec to control

close()¶

Close connections and sockets.

handshake()¶

Establish a connection with the STC.

start()¶

Start the thread’s activity.

It must be called at most once per thread object. It arranges for the object’s run() method to be invoked in a separate thread of control.

This method will raise a RuntimeError if called more than once on the same thread object.

class pushto.stellarium.StellariumRPC(api_url='http://localhost:8090/api')¶

Handles interactions with the Stellarium Remote Control plugin.

Parameters:

api_url (str or None) – url of rpc api, defaults to ‘http://localhost:8090/api’

>>> rpc = StellariumRPC()
get_selected_alt_az()¶

Get a selected target’s Alt and Az at the current time (p+n corrected) and location in Stellarium

Returns:

Alt, Az in decimal degrees

Return type:

list(float)

Note

The object Alt-Az do not update if the Stellarium app is not in focus!!!

get_selected_info()¶

Get info on selected target in Stellarium

Returns:

alot of info

Return type:

dict

get_selected_ra_dec()¶

Get a selected target’s RA and Dec

Returns:

RA, Dec in decimal degrees

Return type:

list(float)

get_status()¶

Get Stellarium status

Returns:

status

Return type:

dict

get_utc()¶
Get Stellarium utc time

need to remove the trailing ‘Z’ from the ‘utc’ field

Returns:

Stellarium UTC

Return type:

astropy.time.Time

select_target(target)¶

Select a target in Stellarium

Parameters:

target (str) – name of target to select

Returns:

status

Return type:

bool

set_time_to_now()¶

Set the time to current time

Returns:

status

Return type:
